html: We have struck a comprehensive deal that allows us to end free movement & leave the CFP & CAP. It includes a free trade area for goods & the ability to conclude trade deals. We can trigger review/seek independent arbitration on the backstop. Importantly the deal ends uncertainty.

 Control of our borders by ending free movement. 

 Control of our money so we can spend it on our priorities like the NHS. 

 Control of our laws by ending the jurisdiction of the ECJ, coming out of the CAP and CFP. 

#Ridge

Bringing the total number of new homes built since 2010 to 1.3 million 

We’re helping fix the housing market so more people can have the security of their own home pic.twitter.com/R9iWaJOaPK

html: Jeremy Heywood was a great civil servant. He put his intellect, professionalism & charm at the service of Ministers of all parties & was never afraid to give honest even if unwelcome advice. Thoughts, prayers & heartfelt sympathy to his family.
text: Jeremy Heywood was a great civil servant. He put his intellect, professionalism & charm at the service of  Ministers of all parties & was never afraid to give honest even if unwelcome  advice. Thoughts, prayers & heartfelt sympathy to his family.

html: Mark Sedwill, the new Cabinet Secretary, says: "We will miss him more than we can say, and will be the poorer without his advice, leadership and extraordinary insight."
text: Mark Sedwill, the new Cabinet Secretary, says: "We will miss him more than we can say, and will be the poorer without his advice, leadership and extraordinary insight."

html: We're removing the cap on how much local councils can borrow to build homes again as we fix the broken housing market. @Theresa_May: "It doesn’t make sense to stop councils from playing their part in solving it...I can announce that we are scrapping that cap." #CPC18pic.twitter.com/3eI0obJJej
text:
We're removing the cap on how much local councils can borrow to build homes again as we fix the broken housing market. 
@Theresa_May: "It doesn’t make sense to stop councils from playing their part in solving it...I can announce that we are scrapping that cap." #CPC18pic.twitter.com/3eI0obJJej

html: Some employers take a % from tips - but we don’t think that’s fair. So we’re stopping this to: Boost pay for workers on low wages. Offer a more honest arrangement for the consumers who leave tips. We want ordinary working people rewarded for their hard work pic.twitter.com/GLLs30W44v
text:
Some employers take a % from tips - but we don’t think that’s fair.

So we’re stopping this to:

 Boost pay for workers on low wages.
 Offer a more honest arrangement for the consumers who leave tips. 

We want ordinary working people rewarded for their hard work pic.twitter.com/GLLs30W44v
